paper_abstract: Grid computing technologies enable large-scale aggregation and sharing of resources via wide-area networks. Grid technologies include elements such as security, job description, information gathering, scheduling, and resource dispatching, among others. In this paper, we address information gathering and focus on providing a domain-based model for network information measurement using Network Weather Service (NWS) on Grid computing environments.
paper_title: A domain-based model for efficient measurement of network information on grid computing environments
